basics.name: Aamir Sohail
basics.label: PhD Student in Psychology
basics.summary: MRC AIM iCASE PhD Student in Psychology at the University of Birmingham

location.address: Room 110, Centre for Human Brain Health

work.name: Centre for Integrative Neuroscience, University of Reading
work.summary: I initially joined as a full-time research assistant (Junior Research Fellow) for six months before incorporating additional administrative duties into my role. During this time I worked as a research assistant for multiple neuroimaging studies employing fMRI, MRS and peripheral imaging. Study lead for an industry-funded behavioural study. Teaching assistant for the 'Introduction to Neuroscience Methods' course.

awards.title: MRC AIM DTP PhD Scholarship (University of Birmingham ~ £90,000)
awards.summary: Four-year fully funded program training PhD students in cutting-edge, inter-disciplinary research methods to create and interrogate innovative models of disease.

awards.title: LGBT+ Inclusion Initiative Fund (University of Reading ~ up to £1,000)
awards.summary: An initiative supporting small-scale projects (£300-£1,000) of all types, led by students and staff at the University, that aid understanding and practical help for LGBT+ communities.
